data.title: Orange County Parks Offer Outdoor Camping Adventures
data.meta_description: Orange County parks offer outdoor camping adventures for anyone seeking a relaxing retreat surrounded by nature at local rustic campgrounds.
data.text:
Orange County parks offer outdoor camping adventures for anyone seeking a relaxing retreat surrounded by nature at local rustic campgrounds.

Five family-friendly Orange County campgrounds offer sought-after amenities including fire rings, grills, water, electricity, picnic tables, showers and restrooms. Happy campers can also enjoy such outdoor activities as playgrounds, beach volleyball, boat ramps, hiking, biking, canoeing, swimming, springs and fishing.

“Camping is an inexpensive way to unwind from the day-to-day stressors and connect with nature,” said Matt Suedemeyer, Division Manager, Parks & Recreation.

More and more families and individuals are seeking what’s called a “calm-cation” a term coined by Campspot, an online marketplace for family campgrounds, cabins, glamping and RV destinations.

Orange County campgrounds provide a calming oasis for those seeking fresh air, gorgeous landscapes and a tranquil setting in Central Florida.

Individual, family and group camping is offered at Clarcona Horse Park, Kelly Park/Camp Joy, Magnolia Park, Moss Park and Trimble Park – with individual site fees starting at $18 for county residents.

Campsites are offered on a first-come first-served basis. Online reservations are available 45 days in advance of arrival date through the Online Camping reservation system.

According to Orange County, here are a few things to know before you go:

Registered pets are welcome at Clarcona, Magnolia and Trimble Parks

Check-in time is 2 p.m.; check-out time is noon

Group camping is tent only, no electric hookups or vehicles

Campsites vary in size, so be mindful with your recreational vehicles

Be aware of bears, gators and snakes in the wild

Some parks require additional entrance fees

Quiet hours are in effect from 10pm-8am

Note restrictions on low-speed vehicle usage in parks

Ask about senior citizen and active military discounts
